action.action-desc: Mr. Nunn of Iowa introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To repeal the provision of law that provides automatic pay adjustments for Members of Congress.

section.header: Elimination of automatic pay adjustments for Members of Congress

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 601(a) of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 (2 U.S.C. 4501) is repealed.
Section 601(a) of such Act (2 U.S.C. 4501) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C) as paragraphs (1), (2), and (3), respectively; and
by striking as adjusted by paragraph (2) of this subsection and inserting adjusted as provided by law.

subsection.text: This section and the amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date on which the 119th Congress convenes.
